noun.description: A mark left on the skin or within body tissue where a wound, burn, or sore has not healed completely and fibrous connective tissue has developed.
examples: a faint scar ran the length of his left cheek

noun.description: A steep high cliff or rock outcrop, especially of limestone.

verb.description: Mark with a scar or scars.
examples: he is likely to be scarred for life after injuries to his face, arms, and legs

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French escharre, via late Latin from Greek eskhara scab.
